title: Challah Bread
ingredients: 2 ½ cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
method: Step 2: Pour warm water into a large bowl; sprinkle yeast over water. Let stand until yeast softens and begins to form a creamy foam, about 5 minutes.
Step 3: Beat in honey, oil, 2 eggs, and salt. Add flour, 1 cup at a time, beating after each addition until dough has pulled together.
Step 4: Turn it out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic.
Step 5: Place dough in a large, lightly-oiled bowl and turn to coat.
Step 6: Cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 1 ½ hours.
Step 7: Punch down dough and turn onto a lightly floured surface. Divide in half and knead each half for 5 minutes or so, adding flour as needed to keep it from getting sticky.
Step 8: Divide each half into thirds and roll into a long snake about 1 ½ inches in diameter.

Step 9: Pinch the ends of the three snakes together firmly and braid from middle. Either leave as a braid or form into a round braided loaf by bringing ends together, curving the braid into a circle, and pinching ends together.
Step 10: Grease two baking trays and place the finished braid or round on each. Cover with a towel and let rise for about 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Step 11: Beat the remaining egg and brush a generous amount over each braid; sprinkle with poppy seeds.
Step 12: Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, about 40 minutes. Cool on a wire rack for at least one hour before slicing.
